title: Man United are playing Liverpool at just the right time, says Gary Neville
text:
Sport Man United are playing Liverpool at just the right time, says Gary Neville Neville believes Jose Mourinho's men have one big advantage over their arch rivals ahead of this Sunday's clash Share Neville reckons Mourinho will be pleased to be playing Liverpool now (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   
Gary Neville believes Manchester United are playing Liverpool at the perfect time. 
Neville's former club may be sixth in the Premier League, four places below Jurgen Klopp's side. 
But a win at Old Trafford for United will see them cut the gap between the clubs to just two points. 
And Neville believes Jose Mourinho's men have one big advantage over their arch rivals ahead of this Sunday's clash. 
United and Liverpool both played EFL Cup semi-final first leg ties this week. 
But with United beating Hull City on Tuesday and Liverpool losing to Southampton on Wednesday, Neville thinks an extra day's rest could be crucial come Sunday. United celebrated a 2-0- win on Tuesday night (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) While Liverpool suffered a frustrating night - and defeat - at Southampton a day later (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Read More The battle which will decide Man United vs Liverpool, according to Jamie Carragher and Gary Neville 
Neville told Sky Sports : "Liverpool have almost had the perfect season in terms of preparation, as they have had quite a few free weeks in between matches – but you could argue this has been the most disrupted period they’ve had. 
"They’ve played quite a few matches in a short time and have stumbled a little bit; losing to Southampton and drawing with Plymouth and Sunderland." 
Neville believes Liverpool's disappointing run could be classed as a "mini-rut" and is adamant the "intense period" can work in United's favour. Liverpool were held 0-0 by Plymouth at Anfield in the FA Cup (Photo: John Powell) And they failed to beat relegation battlers Sunderland too (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Man Utd v Liverpool: Just TWO Anfield stars make Robbie Savage's all-time combined derby XI - do you agree? 
He added: "I’ve always felt this Liverpool team need that perfect week of preparation because they put such incredible energy and effort into the matches and it obviously becomes a lot more difficult to do it every three-and-a-half days because there is less recovery time and training time. 
"They are hitting an intense period and it is a real test for them to come through it. United will probably feel they are playing them at a good time and Liverpool will want to come out of that mini-rut pretty quickly." poll loading Who are you backing for Sunday's game at Old Trafford? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
